meanings.definition: In a manner that shows refusal or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She shook her head rejectingly when offered a second piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: He looked at the painting rejectingly, not impressed by the colors.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed rejectingly at the new toy, clearly uninterested.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered rejectingly, threatening to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's tone was rejectingly firm, signaling the end of playtime.

meanings.definition: Expressing a lack of acceptance or approval.
meanings.sent1: The rejectingly tone in her voice made it clear she was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent2: His rejectingly expression told me he didn't like the surprise party idea.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave me a rejectingly look when I tried to put a hat on him.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a rejectingly appearance, with boarded-up windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent5: The rejectingly attitude of the customer made it challenging to find a solution.
